forum.name: T2 Optional Activity & Discussion: Searching LINCS
forum.intro:
Discussion: Search the LINCS Collection and/or Community

The LINCS Resource Collection:

  • Is online, free, and encompasses 16 topic areas within adult education;
  • Contains multimedia resources that are high-quality, evidence-based, and vetted by experts;
  • Contains a profile for each resource that includes an overview and suggestions for use; and
  • Is searchable and frequently updated.

The LINCS Community:

  • Is online, free, & features 16 topic-specific discussion groups facilitated by professional moderators;
  • Hosts events such as webinars & guest speakers;
  • Distributes relevant news & events from LINCS and the field; and
  • Links to the latest items in the Resource Collection.

Both of the above LINCS tools provide adult educators with access a wide range of ideas, research, and solutions specifically geared towards the field of adult education.

Optional Activity: Continue your exploration of LINCS Resources & share your findings!

1)      Search the LINCS Collection and/or LINCS Community for resources relating to an upcoming lesson (resource does not have to address assessment).

  • To Search the Collection: http://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collection/search-resources
  • To Search the LINCS Community discussions: https://community.lincs.ed.gov/groups
    Then click on the search Tab.

2)      Then share with your course peers the information you gather from your LINCS Exploration in a post below.

Once You Have Completed Your Post:

Click on Intro-Assessment-BE link at the top (or at left under "my Courses") to return to the Course Outline and access the next course activity.
